page.title: 03TYE HALL & ELMS FARM,ROXWELL
page.content: The farm is jointly owned by three people. It covers about 400 acres of land. Until recently they had a herd of dairy cows but these have been sold because too much milk has been produced in this country. There are still fifty beef animals. This year the farmer is growing 230 acres of wheat 90 acres of barley 30 acres of potatoes and 60 acres of vining peas. Contractors bring their own machinery to cut the peas. There is a lot of machinery on the farm including a combine harvester, seven tractors , four ploughs and seven trailers. They grow willow trees to make cricket and rounders bats. Sweet chestnut,Silver Birch and Rowan trees have been planted because the elm trees have died. The barns and sheds are painted and well cared for.
